Forensic Neuropsychological Services

Get objective, board-certified insights on TBI & neurological injury. Our forensic neuropsychologists offer rigorous capacity evaluations. Contact us for a consultation.

Objective neuropsych testing

Evidence-based assessment aligned with advanced imaging.

Capacity + function analysis

Clear answers for IME, disability, and return-to-work questions.

Defensible reporting

Structured findings for legal and clinical decision-making.

Objective Evaluations, Expert Consultation, and Legally Defensible Reports

When neurological evidence, expert opinion, and credible testimony become necessary, partnering with qualified specialists makes all the difference. Our forensic neuropsychology services bridge the gap between complex neuroscience and courtroom litigations or medico-legal consultations, providing credible clarity to all stakeholders.

We provide clear, evidence-based answers for legal and medical cases through a comprehensive, three-step assessment. This process integrates advanced brain imaging (MRI/fMRI), validated neuropsychological testing, and a thorough review of all historical records. Our state-of-the-art technology and clinical rigor provide the unbiased, comprehensive clarity needed in legal and medico-legal matters.

Our three-step assessment combines imaging, testing, and record review to deliver court-ready clarity.

Why Do You Need a Forensic Neuropsychological Evaluation?

Expert neuropsychological consultation is invaluable at various stages of trauma, injury recovery, and rehabilitation. Neuropsychological services are critical in Independent Medical Examinations (IMEs), workers' compensation evaluations, and disability determinations. These services help clarify cognitive impairments and inform treatment planning and management. We also provide expert testimony in legal cases, ensuring accurate evaluations for compensation claims, legal defense, and return-to-work evaluations.

  • Independent Medical Examinations (IMEs), workers' compensation evaluations, and disability determinations.
  • Clearer insight into cognitive impairments to inform treatment planning and management.
  • Expert testimony for compensation claims, legal defense, and return-to-work evaluations.

Who Do We Serve?

We serve attorneys, insurance providers, employers, and individuals seeking expert, rigorous evaluation by providing forensic neuropsychological services. Our assessments offer critical insights for:

Legal & Administrative Claims

Personal injury, workers' compensation, medical malpractice, and long-term disability determinations.

Capacity Evaluations

Evaluations for testamentary capacity (wills/trusts), decisional capacity, and return-to-work.

Clinical Focus

Cases involving traumatic brain injury (TBI) and other neurological conditions affecting behavior, emotional state, and decision-making.

Civil & Criminal Legal Cases

Evaluations for personal injury, medical malpractice, competency, insanity defense, and capital mitigation.

Services We Offer

Independent Medical Examinations (IME)

Independent, expert evaluations to determine the presence and severity of impairment and clarify the extent to which it is related to a specific injury or illness.

  • Objective third-party assessment for civil litigation, insurance claims, and administrative hearings.
  • Detailed reports with testing to verify the validity of reported symptoms.
  • Well-supported opinions on the likely cause of impairment to assist in case resolution.

Record Review

We conduct a comprehensive review of medical, psychological, educational, and vocational records before forming any expert opinion.

  • Establishes the individual's pre-injury level of functioning.
  • Identifies inconsistencies or alternative explanations for current difficulties.
  • Ensures conclusions regarding etiology and prognosis are reliable and grounded.

Consultation Services

Expert guidance to attorneys, physicians, insurers, and other professionals navigating complex medico-legal matters.

  • Case strategy support and expert screening.
  • Evaluation of the strengths and weaknesses of existing evidence.
  • Strategic advice for effective case and treatment management.

Expert Testimony

Clear, concise, and scientifically rigorous opinions in depositions or court.

  • Translates complex brain science into understandable language.
  • Supports decisions related to competency, criminal responsibility, and cognitive impact.
  • Provides critical support for legal and administrative proceedings.

Worker's Compensation Evaluations

Assess the cognitive and psychological consequences of occupational injuries.

  • Clarifies the relationship between work-related injury and cognitive deficits.
  • Determines disability status, work capacity, and required accommodations.
  • Ensures compliance with jurisdictional guidelines for compensation decisions.

Additional Services

Specialized evaluations for a variety of medico-legal and administrative matters, including:

  • Social Security Disability determinations.
  • Assessments for academic or professional accommodations.
  • Capacity evaluations related to wills, trusts, and contracts.
  • Return-to-work assessments.

Why Choose Us?

We deliver scientifically rigorous, thoroughly documented assessments trusted by professionals across the legal and healthcare sectors. Our team of highly skilled and experienced neuropsychologists bring specialized expertise to every case, combining clinical precision with legal acumen to support complex litigation or consultative requirements.

  • Timely reports, thorough documentation, and reliable communication.
  • End-to-end forensic services, from initial case evaluation through deposition and trial support.
  • Clear, defensible reporting for high-stakes decisions.

FAQ

What is Forensic Neuropsychology?

Forensic neuropsychology is a subspecialty that applies brain-behavior principles to legal decision-making. It involves evaluating cognitive and psychological impairments in relation to legal issues, such as the competency to stand trial or compensation claims.

What are the preconditions for a forensic neuropsychological evaluation?

The evaluation requires a referral (usually from an attorney, doctor, or insurance provider), as well as a review of relevant records.

Who are the experts involved?

Forensic neuropsychologists are trained clinical neuropsychologists with specialized expertise in legal matters.

What are the legal provisions for forensic neuropsychology?

Forensic neuropsychology is grounded in established brain-behavior science and operates within the broader legal standards governing expert testimony. In the United States, the Daubert v. Merrell Dow Pharmaceuticals (1993) ruling set key criteria for the admissibility of expert testimony, requiring that such testimony be based on reliable methods, peer-reviewed science, known error rates, and general acceptance within the scientific community.

What types of cases require forensic neuropsychology?

Please get in touch with us to discuss your specific situations.

Forensic neuropsychology is relevant in any legal matter where cognitive, emotional, or behavioral functioning is in question.

  • Personal Injury Claims - evaluation of cognitive, emotional, or behavioral effects following head injury, concussion, or trauma.
  • Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) Litigation - determining the presence, severity, and impact of brain injury.
  • Medical Malpractice - assessing whether neurological or cognitive deficits resulted from medical error or negligence.
  • Workers' Compensation - evaluating cognitive or psychological impairment related to workplace injuries or exposure.
  • Disability Determination - establishing cognitive or psychological limitations relevant to Social Security or private disability claims.
  • Criminal Proceedings - assessing competency to stand trial, criminal responsibility, or mitigation related to neurological or psychiatric impairment.
  • Capacity and Guardianship Evaluations - determining decision-making capacity in civil, medical, or financial matters.
  • Neurodegenerative and Psychiatric Conditions - evaluating cognitive decline or dysfunction affecting functioning or legal competence.
  • Fitness-for-Duty / Return-to-Work Assessments - determining whether cognitive or emotional limitations interfere with occupational performance.
  • Toxic Exposure / Environmental Claims - assessing neurocognitive consequences of exposure to substances such as lead, carbon monoxide, or solvents.
Who can schedule a forensic evaluation?

While anyone seeking an objective assessment may request a forensic evaluation, these evaluations are most often arranged by attorneys, insurance representatives, human resources professionals, or other parties involved in legal, occupational, or administrative proceedings.

What does a forensic neuropsychological evaluation involve?

Our process involves the following steps:

  • Review of relevant records
  • Interviews and consultation
  • Administration of psychological, validity, and neurocognitive measures
  • Comprehensive neuropsychological report and possible court testimony/deposition
Can I bill my insurance for a forensic evaluation?

No, insurance cannot be billed for these assessments as they are not considered medically necessary.

How long does it take to receive my report?

Reports are typically available within 2 weeks after the evaluation, depending on urgency.

Do I need to prepare before my appointment?

Just bring any required assistive devices (glasses, hearing aids), take your regular medications, and get a good night's sleep. Completing any pre-appointment forms will help speed up the process.
